channel.itunes:keywords: boston, university, common, thread, podcast, howard, thurman, center, students, student, college
channel.title: The Common Thread Podcast
channel.itunes:author: The Howard Thurman Center
channel.description: The Common Thread Podcast is recorded and produced by undergraduate students at Boston University. Our goal is to seek out and discuss topics important to our community.
channel.itunes:summary: The Common Thread Podcast is recorded and produced by undergraduate students at Boston University. Our goal is to seek out and discuss topics important to our community.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Common Thread podcast is created by students at Boston University.

item.title: Martin Luther King - His Last Years
item.description: Martin Luther King Jr. is tragically misrepresented as a simple idealist who offered moving oratory. In truth, he was much more than this. He was a revolutionary leader who evolved to face the challenges posed to his movement and offered radical proposals to solve the plight of the poor. Listen to us discuss the final years of his life based on extensive research and conversations with Reverend Julian Cook and Mr. Ryan Hendrickson.
item.itunes:summary: Martin Luther King Jr. is tragically misrepresented as a simple idealist who offered moving oratory. In truth, he was much more than this. He was a revolutionary leader who evolved to face the challenges posed to his movement and offered radical proposals to solve the plight of the poor. Listen to us discuss the final years of his life based on extensive research and conversations with Reverend Julian Cook and Mr. Ryan Hendrickson.
item.itunes:subtitle: MLK is tragically misrepresented in history. Listen to hear about his last, radical years.

item.title: Mental Health - Episode 1
item.description: The mental health and wellbeing of students on college campuses across the nation is a increasingly prevalent and important issue. At the end of Spring semester 2016, we interviewed several students, as well as the director of Behavioral Medicine at BU, Dr. Carrie Landa. In this episode we interview recent Psychology grad from BU, Emme Parks. She discusses the group she founded, All for One, along with her experience with Behavioral Medicine at BU.
item.itunes:summary: The mental health and wellbeing of students on college campuses across the nation is a increasingly prevalent and important issue. At the end of Spring semester 2016, we interviewed several students, as well as the director of Behavioral Medicine at BU, Dr. Carrie Landa. item.itunes:subtitle: The mental health and wellbeing of students on college campuses across the nation is a increasingly prevalent and important issue.

item.title: Mental Health - Episode 2
item.description: In this episode we interview a senior psychology major from BU, Sravya Vajram. She discusses the group she founded, SpeakUP, an independent and student-run support group on campus. As well, we discuss the importance of being vulnerable and confiding in peers when dealing with mental health issues. Later in the episode, we also discuss student's general experience with Behavioral Medicine, and ways that communication between students and SHS can improve.

item.itunes:subtitle: We interview Sarvya Vajram, a student who has founded a independently run support group on campus

item.title: Mental Health - Episode 3
item.description: In this episode we interview director of Behavioral Medicine at SHS, Dr. Carrie Landa. We talk about some of the functions of Behavioral Medicine, including how appointments are prioritized, the purpose of BU's services, and the programs SHS is creating to educate the student body and faculty about mental health awareness and communication.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we interview director of Behavioral Medicine at SHS, Dr. Carrie Landa. We talk about some of the functions of Behavioral Medicine, including how appointments are prioritized, the purpose of BU's services, and the programs SHS is creating to educate the student body and faculty about mental health awareness and communication.
item.itunes:subtitle: We interview Dr. Carrie Landa, director of Behavioral Medicine.

item.title: Dispatch from Calais
item.description: In this episode of The Common Thread Podcast, we interview BU student Smaranda Tolosano who visited the refugee camp in Calais, France a few days before its shutdown.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of The Common Thread Podcast, we interview BU student Smaranda Tolosano who visited the refugee camp in Calais, France a few days before its shutdown.
item.itunes:subtitle: We interview BU student Smaranda Tolosano who visited the refugee camp in Calais, France

item.title: Sanctuary Campus
item.description: Listen to us talk with Marwa Sayed, a student activist who launched a petition late last year to make BU a 'sanctuary campus'. We define actions cities and campuses can take, discuss the potential limitations and delve into the way activism is changing by the day as events unfold. If you want to zoom in on the grassroots in the Trump Era, spin this Thread.
item.itunes:summary: Listen to us talk with Marwa Sayed, a student activist who launched a petition late last year to make BU a 'sanctuary campus'. We define actions cities and campuses can take, discuss the potential limitations and delve into the way activism is changing by the day as events unfold. If you want to zoom in on the grassroots in the Trump Era, spin this Thread.
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen to us talk with Marwa Sayed, a student activist who launched a petition late last year to make BU a 'sanctuary campus'.

item.title: Independent Learning
item.description: HTC Ambassador Yash Kothari sat down with Noam Chomsky because he had the guts to simply email him and ask for an appointment. This initiative fascinated us, so we asked Yash to talk. Yash, who will graduate in May, has a totally unique philosophy on independent learning in college. Spin this Thread if you want to hear about how you might also become an ambitious learner too.
item.itunes:summary: HTC Ambassador Yash Kothari sat down with Noam Chomsky because he had the guts to simply email him and ask for an appointment. This initiative fascinated us, so we asked Yash to talk. Yash, who will graduate in May, has a totally unique philosophy on independent learning in college. Spin this Thread if you want to hear about how you might also become an ambitious learner too.
item.itunes:subtitle: We talk with Yash Kothari, who has a unique philosophy on independent learning, and who also got to sit down with Noam Chomsky.

item.title: BU College Republicans
item.description: The Republican Party is now in power across our federal government, holds the majority of governorships and of state legislative bodies. Yet, in the wake of President Trump's rise and all the coverage of his personality and character, it can seem like we're still an election season rather than a season of governance. We wanted to drive to the root of substantive issues so we spoke with Corey Pray, President of BU College Republicans, and Anastasia Koartes, Secretary of BU College Republicans. This discussion covers a lot of ground, from the diversity of conservative thought, Republican methods of appealing to millennials, foreign policy, and other prevalent issues.

item.title: Summer in Palestine
item.description: This episode features a conversation with recent Boston University graduate Maya Gazhal, who shares his experiences and perspectives about spending a summer in Palestine as an activist, teacher and IT guy. Given how controversial and charged the topic of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict is, we approached this episode with the intent of understanding why one of our peers would go to Palestine and what he observed while he was there. We hope you find it interesting, as we did. The views articulated in this interview are those of the speaker and are not representative of the opinions of the Common Thread Podcast and Howard Thurman Center.

item.title: Oscars Roundtable
item.description: Four Thread team members, Lucas, Varsha, Elliot and Kobe, sit down with Annalise Lamberty, a BU filmmaker, and Elliot Masters, an actor from Emerson, to break down this year's best picture nominees.
item.itunes:summary: Four Thread team members, Lucas, Varsha, Elliot and Kobe, sit down with Annalise Lamberty, a BU filmmaker, and Elliot Masters, an actor from Emerson, to break down this year's best picture nominees.
item.itunes:subtitle: The team along with 2 guests break down this year's best picture nominees and more.

item.title: Conservative Climate Action
item.description: Recently, the Climate Leadership Council brought together some prominent establishment conservatives––including several former cabinet officials––to release a novel plan to combat climate change: "The Conservative Case for Carbon Dividends". This prompted us to sit down with James Baldwin, a lecturer in the Earth and Environment Department at Boston University. We discuss his ongoing research, explore the range of possible outcomes for the species and analyze this plan in its political context.
item.itunes:summary: Recently, the Climate Leadership Council brought together some prominent establishment conservatives––including several former cabinet officials––to release a novel plan to combat climate change: "The Conservative Case for Carbon Dividends". This prompted us to sit down with James Baldwin, a lecturer in the Earth and Environment Department at Boston University. We discuss his ongoing research, explore the range of possible outcomes for the species and analyze this plan in its political context.
item.itunes:subtitle: We sit down with James Baldwin, a lecturer in the Earth and Environment Department, and talk about climate action and our future.

item.title: French Presidential Election
item.description: On this episode we sit down with two Parisians to discuss the import of the upcoming French presidential election. Spin this Thread to learn about the candidates, the issues, and why this election is a major test for the post-WWII international order.
item.itunes:summary: On this episode we sit down with two Parisians to discuss the import of the upcoming French presidential election. Spin this Thread to learn about the candidates, the issues, and why this election is a major test for the post-WWII international order..
